title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 6 of 8)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using vertical-slice strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Kanban Application Board
buildSequence.summary: Implements Kanban board interface for application status tracking with drag-and-drop functionality. Provides visual pipeline management for job applications across different stages.
testableOutcomes: Applications page displays horizontal Kanban board layout with distinct status columns
Kanban board shows columns for Applied, Interview Scheduled, In Progress, Offer, and Rejected statuses in logical workflow order
Each column displays clear header showing status name and count of applications in that column
Application cards appear in columns matching their current status with company name, job title, and application date
Cards within same status column are ordered by most recent application date first
Applications with no status appear in Applied column by default
Column headers display accurate count of cards, showing 0 for empty columns
Card counts update automatically when cards are moved between columns
Clicking and holding application card makes it draggable with visual feedback
Hovering dragged card over different column highlights target column as valid drop zone
Releasing card over valid column moves card to new column and updates application status
Releasing card outside valid drop zones returns card to original position without status change
Card count updates immediately when applications are added or deleted
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Drag-and-drop functionality requires careful touch device support. Status transition validation must prevent invalid moves. Performance optimization needed for large numbers of applications. Real-time updates for collaborative scenarios.

buildSequence.title: Kanban Persistence & Empty States
buildSequence.summary: Implements automatic persistence of drag-and-drop status changes and proper handling of empty Kanban columns. Ensures application status updates are saved to the database and empty columns remain functional for drag operations.
testableOutcomes: Application status is immediately updated in database when drag-and-drop operation completes successfully
Card returns to original position and error message displays when drag-and-drop fails due to network issues
All cards appear in correct positions after page refresh, reflecting latest status changes
Last modified timestamp updates when application status changes via drag-and-drop
Empty columns remain visible with headers and structure when containing no applications
Empty columns highlight as valid drop targets when cards are dragged over them
Cards can be successfully dropped into empty columns and count updates to 1
Helpful message displays when all columns are empty, guiding users to add applications

deliverables: Enhanced KanbanColumn.tsx with empty state handling
Enhanced ApplicationCard.tsx with drag state management

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on optimistic updates with rollback on failure. Implement proper error boundaries for drag operations and ensure empty column drop zones remain active.

buildSequence.title: Follow-up Reminder System
buildSequence.summary: Implements automated email reminder system that sends follow-up notifications 7 days after job applications. Includes snooze functionality (3, 7, 14 days) and dismiss options with proper email content and action handling.
testableOutcomes: Email reminder is sent to user when application has 'Applied' status and created date is exactly 7 days ago
No email reminder is sent when application created date is less than 7 days ago
No duplicate email reminder is sent when reminder was already sent for application over 7 days old
Separate email reminders are sent for each eligible application when multiple applications qualify
Reminder is logged as failed and no email sent when user has invalid or missing email address
Next reminder is scheduled 3 days from now when user clicks '3 days' snooze option in email
Next reminder is scheduled 7 days from now when user clicks '7 days' snooze option in email
Next reminder is scheduled 14 days from now when user clicks '14 days' snooze option in email
New reminder email is sent when snooze period expires for snoozed reminder
Subsequent reminders continue to be sent when reminder has been snoozed multiple times
Error message displays and no snooze action taken when invalid or expired snooze link is clicked
No further reminders are sent for job application when user clicks 'Dismiss' option in email
Dismissed application is skipped when system runs future reminder jobs
Job application details show reminder status as 'Dismissed' when reminder has been dismissed
Error message displays and no dismiss action taken when invalid or expired dismiss link is clicked
Reminder email contains job title, company name, and application date when received
Reminder email contains clearly labeled buttons for 'Snooze 3 days', 'Snooze 7 days', 'Snooze 14 days', and 'Dismiss'
Reminder email includes subject line that clearly identifies it as a follow-up reminder
Reminder email includes helpful text suggesting follow-up actions user can take
User is taken to confirmation page showing action taken when clicking any action button in email
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires email service integration and secure token generation for action links. Implement proper duplicate prevention and handle edge cases for timezone differences in scheduling.

buildSequence.title: Reminder Status Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements automatic cancellation of follow-up reminders when application status changes to non-applicable states (Interviewing, Rejected). Ensures reminder lifecycle is properly managed based on application status transitions.
testableOutcomes: All pending reminders are cancelled when application status changes from 'Applied' to 'Interviewing'
All pending reminders are cancelled when application status changes from 'Applied' to 'Rejected'
Snoozed reminders are cancelled when application status changes from 'Applied' to 'Interviewing'
Snoozed reminders are cancelled when application status changes from 'Applied' to 'Rejected'
No reminder cancellation occurs when application with 'Applied' status has no pending reminders and status changes to 'Interviewing' or 'Rejected'
New reminders are not automatically re-enabled when application status changes back to 'Applied' after reminders were cancelled
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Implement event-driven architecture to handle status changes. Ensure proper cleanup of scheduled reminders and maintain audit trail of cancellation actions.

buildSequence.title: Data Privacy & Local Storage
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive local data storage architecture ensuring all user data (CV, preferences, applications) is stored exclusively in local PostgreSQL database with no unauthorized external transmission. Establishes data privacy verification mechanisms and optional Claude API integration with minimal data sharing.
testableOutcomes: CV data uploaded through system is stored only in local PostgreSQL database with no external network requests
User preferences configuration saves exclusively to local database without external API calls
Job application creation and updates persist only in local PostgreSQL with no external data transmission
Claude API integration transmits only minimal request data and stores responses locally
System operates fully offline for all CV viewing, editing, and preference management functions
Network monitoring shows no unauthorized external data transmission during any system operation

deliverables: Database migration for privacy audit logs

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical security implementation requiring careful network request monitoring and data flow validation. Must ensure Claude API integration maintains privacy boundaries while preserving functionality.

buildSequence.title: Data Transmission Verification
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive network traffic monitoring and data flow verification system to guarantee no unauthorized external data transmission occurs during system operations. Provides audit trails and real-time monitoring capabilities.
testableOutcomes: Network traffic monitoring shows zero user data transmission to unauthorized external services
Data flow verification confirms all user data persistence occurs exclusively in local PostgreSQL database
System startup performs no automatic data synchronization or backup to external services
Privacy audit logs capture and verify all network requests with data classification
Real-time monitoring dashboard displays current data transmission status and violations

deliverables: Network monitoring configuration and test suite

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires integration with system-level network monitoring tools and careful configuration to avoid false positives while maintaining security guarantees.

buildSequence.title: URL Import System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive job URL import system supporting major job platforms (Indeed, Glassdoor, RemoteOK, WeWorkRemotely, AngelList) and company career pages. Provides intelligent content extraction, data normalization through existing pipeline, and robust error handling for various URL formats and edge cases.
testableOutcomes: Valid Indeed job URL successfully imports with complete job title, company, description, and requirements extracted
Valid Glassdoor job URL successfully imports with all available job details and salary information normalized
Valid RemoteOK job URL successfully imports and integrates with existing RemoteOK scraper data structures
Valid WeWorkRemotely job URL successfully imports with location data standardized through existing pipeline
Valid AngelList job URL successfully imports with startup-specific metadata properly categorized
Company career page URLs successfully import with job details extracted using generic content detection
Invalid URL format submission returns specific validation error message without system crash
Non-existent URL submission returns appropriate error message with retry suggestions
Imported job data undergoes complete normalization pipeline producing schema-compliant records
Extracted salary data is normalized to consistent format matching existing job records
Missing optional fields are handled gracefully with null values and no processing errors

deliverables: Database migration for imported jobs tracking

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex implementation requiring platform-specific extraction logic and robust error handling. Must integrate seamlessly with existing scraping infrastructure while handling diverse URL formats and content structures.

buildSequence.title: URL Import Error Handling & Validation
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive error handling and validation for URL-based job imports. Provides clear error messages for various failure scenarios including network issues, authentication requirements, and malformed content.
testableOutcomes: System displays 'Job posting not found' error message when URL returns 404 status
System displays 'Connection timeout' error message when URL fetch exceeds timeout limit
System displays 'Access blocked' error message when encountering anti-bot protection
System displays 'Unable to parse job data' error message when HTML structure is malformed
System displays 'Authentication required' error message when URL requires login
System automatically adds https:// protocol to URLs submitted without protocol
System rejects URLs with unsupported protocols (ftp, file) with appropriate error message
System logs all import success and failure events with platform identifier and error type
Analytics endpoint returns success/failure rates grouped by platform for monitoring
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on comprehensive error classification and user-friendly error messages. Implement robust retry logic for transient failures. Ensure all error scenarios are properly logged for debugging and analytics.

buildSequence.title: Text-based Job Entry
buildSequence.summary: Enables users to manually paste job description text and uses AI parsing to extract structured job data. Includes text validation, AI-powered extraction, and normalization pipeline integration for consistent data quality.
testableOutcomes: Text input field accepts up to 10,000 characters with validation error for excess content
System preserves original formatting including line breaks and special characters during processing
AI parsing extracts job title with minimum 80% accuracy on standard job postings
AI parsing extracts company name with minimum 85% accuracy on standard job postings
AI parsing extracts job requirements as structured list from requirements sections
AI parsing extracts required skills as structured list from job descriptions
AI parsing extracts salary ranges in standardized format with currency identification
AI parsing correctly identifies remote work status (remote/hybrid/on-site) from text
Normalization pipeline standardizes job titles according to predefined taxonomy
Normalization pipeline converts salary ranges to consistent currency and time period format
System provides manual entry form when AI parsing service is unavailable
System handles non-English job text with graceful fallback to manual entry
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical dependency on AI service reliability. Implement robust fallback mechanisms and comprehensive error handling. Focus on parsing accuracy metrics and user feedback collection for continuous improvement.

buildSequence.title: AI Parsing Review & Confidence Handling
buildSequence.summary: Provides user interface for reviewing and correcting AI-parsed job fields with confidence indicators. Enables manual corrections and feedback collection to improve parsing accuracy over time.
testableOutcomes: Review screen displays all extracted fields in editable form with clear field labels
Form immediately reflects changes when user modifies any parsed field value
Empty fields that could not be parsed are clearly marked as requiring manual input
Fields with low confidence parsing are highlighted with visual indicators for verification
User can click on original text reference to view source text section used for extraction
Manual corrections override AI-parsed values when job is saved to database
System prevents saving when required fields are missing or contain invalid data
Each parsed field displays confidence indicator (high/medium/low) with appropriate styling
System suggests manual verification for fields with confidence below threshold
User can provide optional feedback on parsing accuracy after making corrections
System logs low-confidence parsing cases for model improvement tracking
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on intuitive user experience for field correction workflow. Implement clear confidence visualization and efficient feedback collection. Ensure seamless integration with existing job creation pipeline.
